results.title: Lucky
results.creator_credit: John Goldschmidt and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
A boy of 18 re-enacts the way he left his home in Devon and went to London, without money but with high hopes. There he keeps alive cadging and stealing. He takes drugs and is eventually taken to hospital after collapsing on the street. Following this, he is put in touch with the Department of Social Security who help in his rehabilitation.

results.title: Learning to lose
results.creator_credit: David Mills and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World in action”.
Looks at criticism of the English educational system which maintains that its emphasis on theory over practical skills leaves students less employable. Shows some alternative programs which have succeeded.
results.description:

results.creator_credit: Arthur G. Wooster and Anthony Gilkison Associates

results.title: Vasaloppet: the Vasa ski race = the Wasa ski race
results.brief_description: The Vasa Ski Race in Sweden is the biggest ski race in the world. The race which is held in memory of the King Gustav Vasa, who fled the Danes in 1530, is held every year on the first Sunday of March. Some ten thousand competitors enter this unusual and exciting cross-country ski race. Film includes re-creation of the 1530 event interspersed with shots of the race taken from the feature film ‘Gustav Vasa’.
results.title_for_label: Vasaloppet: the Vasa ski race = the Wasa ski race

Some ten thousand competitors enter this unusual and exciting cross-country ski race. Film includes re-creation of the 1530 event interspersed with shots of the race taken from the feature film ‘Gustav Vasa’.

results.title: Valleys and people
results.creator_credit: Douglas M. Robinson and Summit Film Productions
results.brief_description: A story of the accomplishments of Ontario’s Conservation authorities Branch, Department of Energy and Resources Management in Canada. Looks at how a conservation authority works and emphasises the need to retain the balance of nature.

results.title: Usutu
results.creator_credit: Stephen Peet, Raymond Spottiswoode, Courtaulds and Film Centre
results.brief_description: Describes a large afforestation project in Swaziland, which involved the planting of 50 million trees and the construction of a specially designed pulp mill. With the forest grew a new town, with schools, clinics and other social amenities.

results.title: Using small equipment in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Movement education”
Illustrates a variety of equipment including hoops, beanbags, and individual ropes that can be used in movement education. Shows where and how to use the equipment. Quality and variety of movement, partner work and a card system for movement education are discussed.

results.title: Using large apparatus in movement education (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glenn Kirchner and Burbank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Movement education”
This film shows how the use of different types of large apparatus can extend and challenge children’s creative and physical abilities. It also shows how to combine the use of small and large equipment.
